I would agree that the Copper Golem should be able to access Barrels, perhaps Trapped Chests? It might become a bit troublesome at times. However, accessing the Ender Chest is not a possibility, as the Copper Golem cannot be tied to Player NBT, nor can it be tied to the Player's Ender Chest NBT. Furthermore, this functionality would cause a figurative MOUNTAIN of issues on Multiplayer.
Ender chests make no sense here, for the same reason ender chests don't work with hoppers.
Ender chests wouldn't work but shulker boxes should also be included
I wish it could be possible

Like I mentioned above, the Copper Golem is about 2 and a half blocks tall. This makes the Snow Golem summoning configuration the most viable as it closely matches the combined height of the summoned Golem and chest. Here is a comparison image below:

I agree. A copper chest requires eight copper ingots to craft. It doesn't really make sense how one extra ingot and a carved pumpkin are enough to create an additional Copper Golem with the chest. Two blocks of copper would mean the Copper Golem is composed of a block of copper and one copper ingot (for the lightning rod) which makes perfect sense.

Furthermore, players might accidentally construct a Copper Golem inside a Trial Chamber if they place down a carved pumpkin on the floor to make room in their inventory. Also, placing jack o' lanterns on your copper floored base for decoration would be trickier. Very specific situations I know, but just more to consider on this subject.
Hah I made a similar post just now. I also wondered about the Trial Chamber being a potential problem, but suggested a copper rod on top of the build.
It should be copper block, carv pumpkin, lightning rod

I love this idea!

I also tried to make an elevator with the happy ghast.

To hide the bubble column, I tied the ghast to a skellyhorse in a bubble column using a lead.

But it only works if the player isn't standing on or riding the ghast.

Going off the new lead mechanics, maybe you could fix (up to 12?) rafts together (the connection would have to be more rigid than a lead) using bamboo to act as the base for your "ship". Then you could add a certain number of blocks to the raft depending on the size of the floor.

I don't think it is reasonable to expect free form building off a raft.

But... you would be able to outfit a raft with certain blocks. Like a furnace, crafting table, chests, carpet, banner etc. Maybe the work they have done with the happy ghast would enable collision with these blocks; or maybe they would just be visual decoration on the model, and you would access everything from your inventory!
Chain connections could be used to set an anchor or leave buoys floating in the water!
